channel.title: (an unorganized stream-of-consciousness) on this site
channel.description:
the scene is axually pretty much dead as of now, minus little cliques following rsbot-spinoffs, and i think it opens up a perfect opportunity to seize control and try and centralize runescape cheating at moparisthebest.
the only problem is that we need something unique to stimulate the cheating community at large to take action and reinvigorate the forums. projects created by the "elite" member groups (CMs, CCs, Vets) would probably do best, while allowing the public to subscribe to occassional releases etc. this makes sense as it really is the "elite"'s duty to progress and keep moparisthebest as an integral part of the scene, just as it is the people's duty to keep a nation powerful. now to the objective of this thread; this should act as a sort of initiative to start using the boards as a breeding ground for brainstorming ideas for practical projects that we can reasonably do in a few months maximum to reinforce the site's standing in the cheating scene. no special formats for these ideas, just they should keep it civil and rational, and therefore follow any other rules on posts. i think a few projects we could work on could be a reliable deobfuscator or decompiler, jagex-format codecs, etc -- generally the kind of tools moparisthebest is willing to fund.
i think the main problem with the current attempt to stimulate the cheating scene is that it almost directly targets moparscape and private servers, which aren't "causes" that most people feel comfortable to be working for. it has a good motive, money, but because of viral anti-social segregationist and elitist thought, most find it demeaning to work for moparscape. i think one of the main reasons for this rift is the fact that the communities are separated fundamentally at their core; it is for this reason i think that moparscape and moparisthebest should be once-again reunited under a common umbrella.
this reorganization should also encompass a more logical structuring of the forums. as they should be, suggestions on how to reformat this forum should also be encouraged.
thoughts on the plan? ideas to incorporate? post them here.

item.title: (an unorganized stream-of-consciousness) on this site
item.dc:creator: @Taios Taios
item.description:
@Taios wrote:

Ollie:

Ok there may be an intellectual challenge involved, but usually them projects do not finish. The bots which have been made with profit in mind are still around today.

I’d say there’s more benefit for personal intellectual challenge though. More time to explore etc rather than the intenseness because of loosing money.

Read full topic

item.title: (an unorganized stream-of-consciousness) on this site
item.dc:creator: @Iamadam Iamadam
item.description:
@Iamadam wrote:

Class hierarchy (very happy how this was implemented - recursively compares superclasses up the tree), constructor count, field types & count, method return types, counts, arg types, length, fields of the class object type.
Also takes into account the number of times fields from a class are accessed (getfield/putfield).

Read full topic

item.title: (an unorganized stream-of-consciousness) on this site
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

i had a few that dealt with the class hierarchy; depth, ancestor count, descendent count, sibling count, child count, maximum leaf depth and interface count (that i can remember)

there were some to do with coupling (although implemented naively), access flags, public/private field/method/constructor counts

but its completely up to whoever is implementing it

Read full topic

item.title: (an unorganized stream-of-consciousness) on this site
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:145, topic:384071”][quote author=Ollie link=topic=479828.msg3540001#msg3540001 date=1300796867]
I’m Guessing for calculating the distance you are calculating the difference between:

  • Class modifiers
  • Super-classes
  • Interfaces
  • Field count & modifiers
  • Method count & modifiers
  • Instruction count

Have I missed anything?
[/quote]
That’s pretty much what frank_'s first attempt had. Pretty sure he managed at least two dozen metrics at some stage or another. Too bad he scraps everything.[/quote]

Obviously I would split fields into types, and total counts,
Method return types, parameters etc etc. so it would come to about 15 or so different metrics

Read full topic

item.title: (an unorganized stream-of-consciousness) on this site
item.dc:creator: @Iamadam Iamadam
item.description:
@Iamadam wrote:

I haven’t designed it to average a bunch of versions.
I’m happy with the way it works now - it could be done much more ‘correctly’ - but it works better than it needs to already. If I had the time I’d work on it more but pretty busy at the moment. When i get a chance I’ll upload it and someone else can try to work on it (although its more a proof of concept, and a rewrite would be better - since I figured it out as I went, its not done elegantly).

Read full topic
